result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 2 years.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan; be in full compliance with plan before license reinstated.

miscConds.notes:
The Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1000.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.  
Pay all supervision fees.
Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge.
If revoked, the Court ordered that all financial obligations be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.

Seek/maintain full time employment.
Participate in job/vocational training.
Obtain Mental Health evaluation and complete any follow-up care/treatment.

Participate in Parenting counseling.
Participate in Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.

Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens- no controlled substances unless prescribed for mental health treatment by physician licensed in WI.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

timeConds.notes:
With release for employment- good time allowed.
***7-14-2015, Judge Moroney; Court allows transfer of condition time to either Dodge or Washington County.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

/from Attorney Kees, dated 7/08/15, received and filed with:
 - proposed order.
WCS Status Report, received and filed.
Per documentation and e-mail from defense counsel, the final pretrial had been converted to plea and sentencing.  ADA Schoepp notified via e-mail.
WCS report received and filed.

Defendant Matthew J Larson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties held brief sidebar.  Court ordered case set for jury trial.  Due dates for motions are as follows:  movant has until 5/11/15; response due by 5/26/15; reply due by 5/31/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due from both parties one (1) week prior to the final pretrial date.  Any alibi notices must be filed according to statute.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS report received and filed.

Defendant Matthew J Larson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
